content: In a small town, there are 10 houses on one side of the street and 15 houses on the other side. If each house has at least one dog, and there are a total of 30 dogs in the town, what is the minimum number of houses that have more than one dog?

These 5 extra dogs must be distributed among some of the houses, meaning those houses will have more than one dog. I need to find the minimum number of houses that have more than one dog, so I should try to distribute these extra dogs in a way that minimizes the number of houses getting multiple dogs.

To minimize the number of houses with more than one dog, I should give as many extra dogs as possible to fewer houses. For example, if I give all 5 extra dogs to one house, then only that one house would have more than one dog. But is that possible?

Does that work? Yes, that seems to satisfy the condition.
